quest.name: In Node We Trust
journal: The eons-old guidance node is patiently awaiting instructions.

It appears that the guidance node can show you the way to the Aetherochemical Research Facility upon the “Flagship,” Azys Lla's central isle. Ask Alphinaud how he feels about following the suspiciously helpful Allagan machine.
For want of a surer way to reach your destination, it is decided that you will trust the guidance node. Follow the node to Matter Conduit II-III and ask it for further instructions.
If the guidance node is to be believed, the matter conduit will send you to the Beta Quadrant. Operate the Allagan transporter at the center of the conduit when you are ready to proceed.
You use the matter conduit and emerge, as promised, in the Beta Quadrant. Request further instructions from the guidance node.
In a manner ill befitting a machine, the guidance node expresses surprise that the conduit still functions correctly after over five millennia of disuse.
objectives: Speak with the guidance node at Matter Conduit II-III.
Use the Allagan teleporter to travel to the Beta Quadrant.
Speak with the guidance node at Matter Conduit III-II.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Greetings, MistressMaster Forename. Is there something you wish to know?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tell me how to reach the Flagship.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tell me how to reach the Aetherochemical Research Facility.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing in particular, Gilly.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Determining a recommended location for routine inspection...
Location determined.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Requesting access to the Aetherochemical Research Facility...
Access granted. Generating route...

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Route generated. Commencing guidance to chosen destination.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Please be aware that the designated route may take you through restricted sectors, and that the isle's defense systems may attempt to terminate you.
Be kindly reminded that, in accordance with the terms and conditions of use, you and your party assume all risk of damage or injury, including death, that may occur en route to your destination.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Warring Triad... I somehow doubt they are amenable to negotiation.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: What in the Fury's name is that thing?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Warring Triad puts me in mind of a tale from my childhood. It told of three gods locked in perpetual conflict.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, this node turned out to be rather more useful than I expected!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: A few years back, Wedge decided he wanted a dog. And when we said no, he sulked for a bleedin' month.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Gilly's a good girl! Isn't she a good girl?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Can the guidance node be trusted? I know not, but we have few other options. Let us see where it leads us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, Y'shtola, Estinien─we four shall proceed to the research facility.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Cid, the Excelsior is our sole means of escape. Pray remain here and have her ready to depart at a moment's notice.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Understood. We'll see that she's repaired and ready to fly. If anything happens, just let me know via linkpearl.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Be on your guard, my friends─the enemy could be anywhere.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: First Maggie, and now Gilly... Maybe we should have let him have that dog...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Promise me you'll take good care of Gilly! Don't let any harm come to her!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Should you need to return to Ishgard for supplies, you can use that standard to signal for an Ironworks airship, just as before.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: When your business below is done, let our man at the airship landing know, and he'll ferry you back here to resume the mission.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: So we are to follow that...thing? ...I shall leave it to you to deal with it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though we know little of the node, we know still less of the facility at large. Let us see where it leads us.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> You are currently within the Alpha Quadrant.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: First, you must use the nearby matter conduit to travel to the Beta Quadrant. Please wait a moment while I activate it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If I am not mistaken, this is some manner of teleportation device.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We have scarce begun, and already it leads us to a dead end.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Mayhap the node has further instructions for us.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Conduit activated. You may travel to the Beta Quadrant at your leisure.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If I am not mistaken, this is some manner of teleportation device.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: We have scarce begun, and already it leads us to a dead end.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Mayhap the node has further instructions for us.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: According to my records, this conduit was last serviced approximately five thousand and fourteen years, six months, eleven days, seven hours and thirteen minutes ago.

dialogue.name: GUIDANCESYSTEM
dialogue.text: That it should function without mishap may be described as a miracle.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Are you certain it is wise to trust this orb with our lives?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That node is not what it seems. From amidst the metal, I sense the gaze of a living being. Have care around it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The matter conduit appears to operate on the same principle as the aetherytes. How remarkable that it should still function after all this time...
